arts.ttl: Fulham v Manchester United: Premier League – live
arts.sum: Live updates from the 4.30pm UK time kick-off Any thoughts on the match? Send Tim an email Afternoon everyone and welcome to a game that ought to be a mismatch. A club that has spent £200m this summer is paying a visit to a club that has spent £500,000. And yet, on paper, it’s too close to call. Fulham have continuity on their side. Marco Silva, who took over as their manager in summer 2021, is now the third longest-serving manager in the Premier League. (Pep Guardiola and Mikel Arteta are the only PL bosses to survive from the BC era – before Covid.) Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Andre Onana left on the bench again as Manchester United prepare to face Fulham
arts.sum: The Cameroon goalkeeper was not in the squad against Arsenal and has now been left on the bench against Fulham

arts.ttl: Manchester United XI vs Fulham – Predicted lineup and team news
arts.sum: Manchester United travel to Craven Cottage on Sunday under significant early-season pressure to secure their first win of the campaign. While there were promising signs in the narrow 1-0 defeat to Arsenal, with new signings connecting well, the result has left Rúben Amorim’s side pointless. arts.ttl: Fulham vs Manchester United – Match preview and team news
arts.sum: Fulham and Manchester United are both chasing their first win of the season as they meet at Craven Cottage on Sunday. Fulham began their campaign with a solid away draw at Brighton. In contrast, Manchester United are already under pressure after an opening-day defeat to Arsenal. The manager has been handed a significant fitness boost ahead of the clash, but faces a key selection dilemma at left-back.
